hint: A set of instructions designed to perform a specific task
definition: A series of steps or procedures that a computer program follows to solve a problem or perform a task

hint: Enables communication between different software systems
definition: An interface or set of protocols that allows different software systems to communicate with each other

hint: A type of data that can only have two values
definition: A data type that can have one of two values, usually denoted as true or false

hint: Stores frequently accessed data
definition: A hardware or software component that stores data so that future requests for that data can be served faster

hint: Identifying and fixing errors in a program
definition: The process of finding and resolving defects or problems within a computer program

hint: A block of code that performs a specific task
definition: A self-contained block of code that performs a specific task and can be reused throughout a program

hint: Defines how different components of a program can interact with each other
definition: A set of methods, procedures, and signals that define how different components of a software system can interact with each other

hint: A self-contained entity that has properties and methods
definition: An instance of a class that encapsulates data and behavior and can interact with other objects through its properties and methods

hint: A function that calls itself
definition: A programming technique in which a function calls itself in order to solve a problem that can be broken down into smaller subproblems

hint: A value that can change during program execution
definition: A container that holds a value, which can be changed or manipulated during program execution

hint: Translates code written in one language to another
definition: A software program that translates code written in one programming language into a different programming language

hint: A collection of data stored in a structured format
definition: A structured collection of data that is stored and managed on a computer system

hint: The process of encoding data so that it can only be read by authorized parties
definition: The process of converting plain text into a coded format that can only be read by authorized parties

hint: A set of reusable components for building software
definition: A set of software components that provides a reusable architecture for developing software applications

hint: A graphical user interface for interacting with software
definition: A type of interface that allows users to interact with a software program using graphical elements such as buttons, menus, and icons

hint: A programming concept where a class inherits properties and behavior from another class
definition: A programming concept where a class is based on another class and inherits its properties and behavior

hint: A lightweight data interchange format
definition: A lightweight data interchange format that is easy for humans to read and write and easy for machines to parse and generate

hint: A collection of pre-written code that can be reused in different programs
definition: A collection of pre-written code that can be used by software developers to perform common tasks without having to write new code from scratch

hint: A programming paradigm that focuses on objects and their interactions
definition: A programming paradigm that uses objects, which are instances of classes, to represent and manipulate data and the actions that operate on that data

hint: A data structure that follows the Last-In-First-Out (LIFO) principle
definition: A data structure that stores a collection of elements and follows the Last-In-First-Out (LIFO) principle, where the last element added to the stack is the first one to be removed

hint: Testing individual units or components of a software system
definition: A software testing technique that involves testing individual units or components of a software system to ensure that they are working correctly

hint: An integrated development environment for writing, testing and debugging software
definition: An integrated development environment (IDE) is a software application that provides comprehensive facilities to computer programmers for software development

hint: Restructuring code without changing its external behavior
definition: The process of restructuring existing computer code without changing its external behavior

hint: A set of protocols and tools for building software
definition: An application programming interface (API) is a set of protocols and tools for building software and applications

hint: A protocol for transferring data over the web
definition: The Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) is an application protocol for distributed, collaborative, hypermedia information systems

hint: A programming technique where a function calls itself
definition: A programming technique where a function calls itself, either directly or indirectly

hint: A synchronization object used to control access to a shared resource
definition: A synchronization object used to control access to a shared resource in a concurrent system

hint: A domain-specific language used in programming and designed for managing data held in a relational database
definition: Structured Query Language (SQL) is a domain-specific language used in programming and designed for managing data held in a relational database management system

hint: A unit of execution within a process
definition: A thread of execution is the smallest sequence of programmed instructions that can be managed independently by a scheduler, which is typically a part of the operating system

hint: The process of converting an object into a stream of bytes for storage or transmission
definition: Serialization is the process of converting an object into a stream of bytes for storage or transmission over a network or to be saved in a file
